channel.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com
channel.description: Find the latest automobile Auto Insight, News & Articles from all top sources for the Indian Auto industry on ET Auto.

image.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com

item.title: Govt's 20% ethanol blending goal in ESY 2025 will need more sugarcane: Report
item.description: By 2025, the government aims to blend 20% ethanol in petrol, which will necessitate higher sugarcane utilization, thereby improving sugar inventory and millers' cash flows. While grain-based ethanol production is set to increase, the reduction in sugarcane output due to erratic rainfall is expected to impact supply, targeting 14% blending in 2024.

item.title: DICV unveils Mechatronics lab to increase efficiency
item.description: The Mechatronics Lab ensures that the software feature functionality of Daimler trucks and buses meets current safety standards while preparing for future global safety regulations. Agile methodologies implemented in the lab allow for the rapid identification and resolution of software bugs through a closed-loop feedback system, which enhances the efficacy of quality and testing processes.

item.title: IIT Delhi study to help develop alternative to lithium-ion batteries
item.description: Researchers at the Indian Institutes of Technology (IIT) Delhi on Friday released a new study about sodium-sulphur (RT-Na/S) batteries that will pave the way for developing an alternative to lithium-ion batteries.

item.title: Ashok Leyland organises ‘Mini Expo’ in Mumbai to showcase advanced MHCV innovations
item.description: The event emphasizes Ashok Leyland’s state-of-the-art MHCV products and vehicles. It is targeted at industry professionals, enthusiasts, and stakeholders keen on the latest advancements in MHCV technology.

item.title: Natron plans USD 1.4 bn sodium-ion battery plant in North Carolina
item.description: Natron also expects the county to apply for a USD 30 million grant from a new state funding program to help prepare or upgrade qualifying industrial sites, the source added.

item.title: Ola Consumer redefines digital commerce to deliver more value to consumers
item.description: Ola Consumer partners with Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) to make commerce accessible, affordable, efficient and sustainable for all and offers innovation and dedication to customer-centric solutions.

item.title: California allows Chinese robotaxi firm WeRide to test with passengers
item.description: The permit from the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) - issued earlier this month for three years - allows WeRide to ferry passengers in test vehicles with a driver and without one. WeRide will not be allowed to offer rides to the general public and cannot charge any fares.

item.title: A Chinese autonomous driving startup is about to go public in the U.S.
item.description: Export controls on Chinese firms by the U.S. government could limit WeRide's access to advanced semiconductors. One WeRide supplier has been designated a "Chinese military company," which could complicate its supply chain if restrictions escalate. A crackdown on Chinese autonomous vehicle companies could curb WeRide's ability to use its technology in America.

item.title: Aptiv expands Chennai plant with USD 45 mn investment
item.description: To begin with, the plant will focus on the domestic market. “Our investment is driven by the pull of the Indian auto market and its shift towards software driven vehicles and higher level of ADAS (advanced driver assistance systems),” said Cole. However in future the company plans to target export markets as well. “We have a strategy to scale up and as we do so we will look at opportunities of exports for non-Indian OEMs as well,” added Cole.

item.title: The role of artificial intelligence in designing next-generation electric powertrains
item.description: Machine learning algorithms sift through vast amounts of data from simulations and real-world tests to identify the perfect combination of motor size, winding configuration, and inverter topology. This data-driven approach leads to powertrains that are more adaptable and efficient, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in electric vehicle design.

item.title: India must spend in green hydrogen R&D, infrastructure: Ganapati Myneni
item.description: To realize its Viksit Bharat 2047 vision, India must enhance R&D, invest in hydrogen production infrastructure, and advance thorium-based molten salt reactors, says Professor Ganapati Myneni. He emphasizes scaling up green hydrogen technologies, improving cost-efficiency, and fostering public-private partnerships to achieve energy independence and global leadership in sustainable energy.

item.title: Cummins India appoints Shveta Arya as MD, effective Sept 1, 2024
item.description: She succeeds Ashwath Ram, who will continue serving the company until August 31, 2024.

item.title: Ki Mobility's myTVS to launch AI-led diagnostics platform for aftermarket car segment
item.description: While the product is currently free for customers, soon the company will look to monetise it. The addressable market for the service is estimated to be 10-12 million vehicles for starters, with a specific focus on those vehicles that are 4-meters and above in length.

item.title: MapmyIndia shares jump 7% as Q1 profit rises 12% Y-o-Y
item.description: Shares of CE Info Systems-owned MapmyIndia on Monday surged 7% to its day’s high of INR 2,380.35 after the company on Friday reported a 12% year-on-year (Y-o-Y) jump in its profit after tax (PAT) at INR 35.9 crore for the June quarter.

item.title: Vitesco Technologies improves profitability in a challenging environment
item.description: “The key financial figures for the second quarter of 2024 illustrate the slow recovery of the market environment in the automotive sector. Despite these challenging conditions, we achieved a further increase in the profitability of Vitesco Technologies,” Andreas Wolf, CEO of Vitesco Technologies, said.

item.title: Ola Maps a gimmick, people should be careful of fly-by-night products: MapmyIndia CEO
item.description: MapmyIndia sent a legal notice to Ola on July 23, three days before the release of Ola Electric's Red Herring Prospectus, for breach of terms and conditions of the licence agreement that Ola Electric had signed in 2021 with the company to use APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) and SDKs (software development kits) for navigation.

item.title: EV charging startup Kazam raises USD 8 mn
item.description: Kazam EV Tch, a startup offering charging products and services for EVs, has raised USD 8 million in its latest funding round from Vertex Ventures. The capital will be deployed to strengthen its tech and product teams.

item.title: Accenture launches LearnVantage Academy for software-defined vehicle
item.description: The SDV Academy offers specialized training modules for enterprises in the automotive industry who want to build skills for software-defined, service-driven digital mobility which is expected to be a USD3.5trillion market and will account for 40% of global revenues in the automotive industry by 2040.

item.title: BMW utilises humanoid robots in Spartanburg plant for automotive manufacturing
item.description: The Figure 02 robot, developed by California-based company Figure, demonstrated its ability to insert sheet metal parts into chassis assembly fixtures. This test signals BMW’s initial foray into the integration of humanoid robots in its production process, aimed at enhancing automation and efficiency.

item.title: 'Biofuel sector has immense potential, may pave way for a sustainable future in India'
item.description: Biofuel sector has immense potential and it may also pave the way for a sustainable future in India, said Ramakrishna YB, an expert at the working group on biofuels under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MoP&NG).
